benchmark_details.name: RetrievalQA
benchmark_details.overview: RetrievalQA is a benchmark comprising 1,271 short-form questions designed to assess adaptive retrieval-augmented generation (ARAG) methods for open-domain question answering, focusing on new world and long-tail knowledge.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the effectiveness of ARAG methods in open-domain question answering by ensuring questions cannot be answered using LLMs' parametric knowledge.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset primarily focuses on short-form QA and does not assess long-form generation tasks.

data.source: Collected from RealTimeQA, FreshQA, ToolQA, PopQA, and TriviaQA datasets.
data.annotation: Questions filtered to ensure they cannot be answered without retrieval.

methodology.calculation: Match accuracy measures if gold answers are included in the model predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher retrieval accuracy indicates more effective methods.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using various sizes of language models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data is obtained from publicly available sources with no personally identifiable information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data constructed using datasets that comply with licensing agreements.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Aligned with institutional, national, and global ethical standards.
